math::InterpolationUtil Class Reference
[Mathematical support classes]

#include <InterpolationUtil.h>

List of all members.

Detailed Description

Utilities for interpolating between key values.


Public Types

enum  BehaviourType { BEHAVIOUR_REPEAT, BEHAVIOUR_OSCILLATE, BEHAVIOUR_RESET, BEHAVIOUR_STOP }

Member Enumeration Documentation

enum math::InterpolationUtil::BehaviourType
 

Animation playback end behaviour.

Enumeration values:
BEHAVIOUR_REPEAT  Animation loops to start after reaching end.
BEHAVIOUR_OSCILLATE  Animation changes direction at the ends.
BEHAVIOUR_RESET  Animation resets to start frame at the end.
BEHAVIOUR_STOP  Animation stops at the last frame.

Member Function Documentation

void math::InterpolationUtil::getFrame (  float  time,
BehaviourType  endbehaviour,
int  keyframes,
float  keyrate,
int *  frames,
float *  phase
)  [static]
 

Returns animation frame numbers which takes animation end behaviour into account.

Parameters:
time Time in seconds.
endbehaviour Animation playback end behaviour.
keyframes Number of key frames in animation.
keyrate Key frame sample rate.
frames [out] Four (4) consecutive key frame numbers. Current one is 1. 0 is the previous key and 2 is the next key and 3 is the key after next.
phase [out] Fraction [0,1] to interpolate between current frame and next frame.

void math::InterpolationUtil::interpolateVectorCatmullRom (  int  dim,
float  u,
const float *  key0,
const float *  key1,
const float *  key2,
const float *  key3,
float *  result
)  [static]
 

Interpolates vector of values using Catmull-Rom interpolation.

Keys are asssumed to have uniform time spacing.

Parameters:
dim Dimensions in each vector.
u Phase of interpolation [0,1].
key0 Previous key.
key1 Current key.
key2 Next key.
key3 Key after next key.
result [out] Interpolated value.

const char* math::InterpolationUtil::toString (  BehaviourType  behaviour  )  [static]
 

Returns string representing animation start/end behaviour type.
